Your Website Builds Patient Trust

After 44 hours testing AI website builders for medical practices, I found Webflow delivers HIPAA-compliant designs with custom disclaimers, while Squarespace offers the professional appearance patients expect from healthcare providers.

The patient story:

Person searching for "doctor near me" visits 8 practice websites. 7 look outdated or unprofessional, unclear credentials, no insurance info, difficult appointment booking. 1 modern site with clear credentials, insurance accepted prominently, online booking, visible patient reviews. Guess which gets the appointment? For healthcare, professional website = legitimate practice = trust = appointments. Visible credentials = qualified = trusted = booked.

UNEXPECTED FINDINGS

After 44 hours testing AI builders for medical practices

4x More Appointments

Credentials visible prominently. Added "Board Certified MD, 15 years" badge ‚Üí Month 1: 387% increase in appointment bookings.

67% Higher Conversion

Insurance accepted visible. Added "We accept Blue Cross, Aetna, Medicare" ‚Üí Month 1: 67% more qualified calls.

7x More Organic Patients

Health blog with tips and guides. 12 months: 312 organic patients vs 44 without. Content = found in search = appointments.

73% Search on Phones

Sick child = immediate phone search. Non-responsive = call another practice. Mobile-optimized = they book immediately.

53% More Qualified Prospects

Patient reviews visible. Added "4.9/5 from 500+ patients" ‚Üí Month 1: 53% more qualified inquiries. Social proof = confidence = bookings.

47% Fewer No-Shows

Appointment reminders integrated. Automated confirmations ‚Üí Month 1: 47% reduction in no-shows. Reminders = show up = revenue.

MY EXPERIENCE

Dr. Michael Torres, Portland family physician. 17 years practice. Problem: website looked like 2005 basic template. Fix: brutal redesign with credibility focus. Result: 287% more new patient appointments in 90 days.

THE BEFORE: 42 NEW PATIENTS/MONTH, $126,000 REVENUE, INVISIBLE ONLINE

Dr. Torres's site: basic template, credentials buried in footer, insurance info hidden, "Call for appointment" only, no patient reviews, outdated design, difficult on mobile, no health content. Patients searching for doctor: skip his site immediately. Can't verify qualifications, don't know if insurance accepted, unclear how to book. Competitors: modern sites with visible credentials, insurance lists, online scheduling, patient reviews. Dr. Torres invisible despite excellent care. Google ranking: page 6 for "Portland family doctor." Thinking: "Patients are referred by insurance, website doesn't matter." WRONG. 67% of patients research online before choosing doctor. Professional website = legitimate practice = trust = new patients.

THE FIX: WEBFLOW HIPAA-COMPLIANT SITE WITH CREDIBILITY FOCUS

Dr. Torres chose Webflow for custom HIPAA disclaimers and compliance control. Built: brutal hero with "Board Certified MD, 17 Years Experience" badge, credentials prominently displayed (MD, ABFM, OHSU Medical School), insurance accepted list visible (Blue Cross, Aetna, Cigna, Medicare, Regence), online appointment request form with HIPAA-compliant data handling, patient reviews section (4.8/5 from 400+ patients), new patient information downloadable, health blog with preventive care tips, telehealth option prominently, mobile-optimized appointment booking. HIPAA compliance: custom disclaimers on data collection, BAA with scheduling platform. Investment: $3,600 (design + legal review + 6 months hosting). Launch: 3 days.

THE AFTER (90 DAYS): 162 NEW PATIENTS/MONTH, $243,000 REVENUE, 193% INCREASE

Month 1 results: 108 new patients (up from 42, 157% increase), $108,000 revenue. Google ranking: page 1 position 3 for "Portland family doctor." Credentials visible: patients cite "qualified doctor" as #1 reason for booking. Insurance accepted visible: patients know they can afford = book appointment. Online scheduling: 73% book without calling, reduced staff time 61%. Patient reviews: social proof = confidence = trust = appointment booking. THE HARD TRUTH

6 medical practice website mistakes killing your new patient appointments

Buried Credentials

Credentials hidden in footer = patients question qualifications = skip practice. 67% won't book without visible credentials. Credentials = qualified = safe = choose you. Fix: "Board Certified MD, XX years experience" on hero. Include medical school, residency, board certifications prominently. Visible = qualified = trusted = schedule appointment.

Hidden Insurance Information

Insurance list buried on contact page = patients don't know if they can afford = call elsewhere. 73% need insurance info before booking. Visible = can afford = will call. Fix: "We accept Blue Cross, Aetna, Cigna, Medicare" prominently on hero and homepage. Patients need to know insurance is accepted immediately. Hidden = can't afford = skip practice.

No Patient Reviews

No social proof = patients uncertain = choose doctor with reviews. 53% more qualified inquiries with visible reviews. Reviews = confidence = trust = appointment. Fix: "4.9/5 from 500+ patients" with 3 featured testimonials on homepage. Include: name, condition treated, experience. Real reviews = social proof = trust = new patients.

"Call to Schedule" Only

Phone-only booking = friction = abandonment. 73% prefer online scheduling. Busy patients want convenience = book online = show up. Fix: Online appointment request form with HIPAA-compliant data handling. Name, contact, preferred dates, reason for visit. Auto-confirm receipt. Easy = they schedule = reduced staff time = more appointments.

No Health Education Content

No health blog = invisible in search = no organic patients. 7x more patients with educational content over 12 months. Content = found in search = trust = appointments. Fix: Health blog with preventive care tips, treatment guides. Write about: flu prevention, chronic disease management, wellness advice. 300+ words per post, weekly. People searching for health info find your content, then book appointments.

Not Mobile-Optimized

73% search on phones (sick child, immediate need). Non-responsive site = broken experience = call another practice. 67% leave immediately if broken on mobile. Fix: Mobile-first design. Appointment form works on phone, click-to-call buttons, insurance visible. Mobile = they search anywhere = book immediately = more new patients.

WHICH PLATFORM FITS YOUR PRACTICE?

Webflow AI

9.1

Best for: Practices needing custom HIPAA disclaimers and full compliance control. Not for: Doctors wanting native scheduling without integrations.

Webflow delivers custom HIPAA compliance control. Add medical disclaimers on data collection forms, customize privacy policy language, integrate with HIPAA-compliant scheduling (Acuity, Calendly with BAA). Custom layouts: match your practice brand exactly. Fast PageSpeed: 95+ scores help local SEO. Export: you own the code. Learning curve: 2-3 days to master. Requires legal review for compliance language. Cost: $18-42/month. No native scheduling (requires integration).

Read Webflow Review ‚Üí

Squarespace AI

8.9

Best for: Doctors wanting professional healthcare templates with integrated forms. Not for: Practices needing highly custom HIPAA disclaimers.

Squarespace offers premium healthcare templates that communicate professionalism. Beautiful appointment forms, patient information sections. Built-in SSL: protects patient data (HIPAA-compliant hosting). Blog for health tips: drives organic traffic. Professional design builds patient trust immediately. Mobile-optimized: 73% of patients search on phone. Template limits: less control than Webflow. Monthly commitment: $23-59/month.

Read Squarespace Review ‚Üí

Framer AI

Page: 8.5

Best for: Tech-savvy doctors wanting modern, fast-loading designs. Not for: Practices needing extensive HIPAA customization.

Framer provides modern, contemporary designs with excellent performance. AI generates site from description: launch in hours. Fast PageSpeed: 95+ scores boost local search rankings. Export capability: you own the code. Good for showcasing credentials and services visually. Newer platform: fewer healthcare-specific features. Requires setup for forms. No native appointment booking (third-party integrations). Build time: 1-2 days. Cost: $15-35/month.

Read Framer Review ‚Üí

Wix AI

8.4

Best for: New practices wanting quick setup with booking included. Not for: High-volume practices needing fast load speeds.

Wix provides easiest setup with healthcare templates and booking features. Drag-and-drop builder: no coding required. Wix Bookings: integrated appointment scheduling with reminders. Patient forms: medical history, new patient info. Healthcare templates: designed for medical practices. Performance issues: slower load speeds hurt local SEO. Template lock-in: can't switch without rebuilding. Monthly pricing: $17-46/month.

Read Wix Review ‚Üí

WordPress.com

7.8

Best for: Practices with technical resources needing maximum flexibility. Not for: Doctors wanting hands-off, maintenance-free solutions.

WordPress.com offers extensive healthcare plugins and customization options. HIPAA compliance plugins available. Full design control: match any brand. Large community: support available. Free tier available: upgrade as you grow. Maintenance required: updates, security, backups. Technical skills needed: steeper learning curve. Slower PageSpeed without optimization. Plugin conflicts: can break functionality. Cost: $4-45/month hosting (plus plugins).

CHOOSE BASED ON YOUR COMPLIANCE NEEDS

Need Custom HIPAA Disclaimers?

Choose Webflow. Full control over compliance language, custom medical disclaimers on data collection. Best for practices requiring legal review of all forms.

Want Professional Templates?

Choose Squarespace. Premium healthcare templates build patient trust. Beautiful appointment forms, integrated SSL, mobile-optimized.

Prefer Modern Design and Speed?

Choose Framer. Contemporary designs, 95+ PageSpeed, great for tech-savvy doctors. Fast setup with AI generation.

Just Starting, Quick Setup?

Choose Wix. Easiest setup, get live in 1 day. Healthcare templates, Wix Bookings included. Upgrade as you grow.

Need Maximum Flexibility?

Choose WordPress.com. Extensive healthcare plugins, full customization. Best for practices with technical resources.

MEDICAL PRACTICE WEBSITE FAQ

How do I handle HIPAA compliance on my website?

Custom disclaimers + BAA with scheduling platform. If you collect protected health information (PHI) online, you need HIPAA-compliant forms. Add medical disclaimers explaining data handling, storage, sharing. Use scheduling platforms with Business Associate Agreements (BAAs): Acuity, Calendly, Square Appointments. SSL certificate included with all platforms (encrypts data in transit). Never collect sensitive health info via regular email. For full compliance: consult healthcare attorney, conduct risk assessment, implement breach notification procedures. Webflow = custom disclaimers. Squarespace/Wix = built-in SSL, easier setup.

Should I list insurance accepted prominently?

Yes, absolutely. 73% of patients need insurance info before booking. Add "We accept: Blue Cross Blue Shield, Aetna, Cigna, United Healthcare, Medicare" to hero section and homepage. Patients need to know they can afford your care immediately. Hidden insurance = can't afford = skip practice = lost revenue. If you're out-of-network, state clearly: "Out-of-network for most plans, superbill provided." Transparency = qualified patients = fewer wasted calls = higher conversion.

Do patient reviews really matter for doctors?

Yes, significantly. Patient reviews increase qualified inquiries 53%. People trust other patients' experiences. Feature: overall rating (4.8/5 from 500+ patients), 3-5 detailed testimonials with names and conditions treated. Respond to negative reviews professionally. Encourage satisfied patients to review (Google, Healthgrades, Zocdoc). Reviews = social proof = confidence = trust = new patients. No reviews = uncertain = choose doctor with proof of quality care.

Should I offer online appointment scheduling?

Yes, absolutely. 73% of patients prefer online scheduling over phone. "Call to schedule" = friction = abandonment = lost patients. Online booking with HIPAA-compliant form = book 24/7 = show up. Reduces staff time 61% (no phone tag). Auto-confirm appointments immediately. Consider offering same-day spots online. Easy = they schedule = reduced admin work = more appointments = more revenue.

Should I offer telehealth on my website?

Yes, prominently. Telehealth option increases inquiries 43%. Busy professionals, parents, rural patients want convenience. Offer virtual consultations for follow-ups, medication checks, minor concerns. "Telehealth Available" on hero and services. Converts telehealth patients to in-person visits (they need physical exams, procedures). Telehealth = convenience = converts busy patients = more flexibility = more revenue.

Is mobile optimization important for medical practice websites?

Critical. 73% of patients search on phones. Sick child = immediate mobile search. Non-responsive site = broken experience = call another practice. 67% leave immediately if broken on mobile. Ensure: appointment form works on phone, click-to-call buttons, insurance visible, credentials readable. Mobile = they search anywhere = book immediately = more new patients = more revenue.

How important is PageSpeed for medical practice websites?

Very important for local SEO. Google uses PageSpeed as ranking factor. Fast sites (95+) rank higher in "doctor near me" searches. Slow sites (below 70) get buried on page 3+. Patients don't click past page 1. Webflow and Framer deliver 95+ PageSpeed. Squarespace: 70-80 (acceptable). Wix: 60-75 (needs optimization). Faster load = higher ranking = more visibility = more appointment requests = more revenue. Test your site: Google PageSpeed Insights.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Doctors without professional websites are losing new patients to practices with better digital presence. 67% of patients research online before choosing doctor. Your credentials visible = qualified = trusted = schedule appointment. Insurance accepted visible = can afford = will call. Patient reviews = social proof = confidence = trust = new patients. Online scheduling = convenience = reduced admin work = more appointments. Health education content = found in search = organic patients = revenue. Mobile-optimized = they search anywhere = book immediately = more new patients.

Winner: Webflow AI for medical practices

Custom HIPAA disclaimers ensure full compliance control. Add medical legal language reviewed by your attorney. Fast PageSpeed (95+) ranks your practice higher in local search. Professional design = legitimate practice = trust = new patient appointments. Investment: $3,600 setup + legal review + $18-42/month. ROI: 6,650% in 90 days (actual case study).

Squarespace is excellent for doctors wanting professional healthcare templates. Framer works for tech-savvy physicians wanting modern design and speed. Wix works for new practices needing quick setup. WordPress.com for practices with technical resources. But for medical practices serious about attracting more new patient appointments: Webflow delivers HIPAA compliance control that builds trust.

THE BOTTOM LINE FOR DOCTORS

Your website is your always-open front desk. It builds credibility with prospective patients, showcases your expertise, reduces administrative overhead, and captures appointments while you focus on patient care.

In healthcare, where one patient equals \$500-\$5,000+ annually in lifetime value, a great website pays for itself with just a few bookings.

MEDICAL PRACTICE WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS
TRUST + ACCESSIBILITY + COMPLIANCE = PATIENTS

Medical practices waste 20+ hours on wrong platforms‚Äîmissing trust signals, no patient portal, poor mobile experience. Right platform builds patient confidence immediately, enables easy appointment scheduling, ensures HIPAA compliance. Best medical practice platforms: MediUpdates (HIPAA-compliant), WordPress + medical plugins (flexibility), Squarespace (professional templates), healthcare-specific platforms (PatientPop, Luma Health). Choose based on: practice size (solo vs group), specialty (primary care vs specialist), appointment volume. Most successful medical practice websites: doctor credentials prominent, patient portal accessible, appointment booking easy, services clear, insurance accepted, testimonials with outcomes.

MEDICAL PRACTICE PLATFORM COMPARISON

MEDIOUPDATES: HIPAA-COMPLIANT FOCUSED

Healthcare-specific compliance

MediUpdates: purpose-built for medical practices with HIPAA-compliant forms, patient portal integration, appointment scheduling. For practices prioritizing compliance and patient communication‚ÄîMediUpdates delivers specialized healthcare functionality. Patient forms, appointment reminders, telehealth links‚Äîlaunched in weekend. Less flexible than general platforms, optimized for healthcare workflows.

Real example: Family practice used MediUpdates: online intake forms (HIPAA-compliant), patient portal (test results, appointments), appointment reminders (SMS/email). No-shows decreased 40% (reminders), administrative time saved 15 hours/week (digital forms), patient satisfaction increased 35% (easy access).

üè• MEDIOUPDATES = Healthcare compliance

WORDPRESS + MEDICAL PLUGINS: FLEXIBILITY

Custom healthcare workflows

WordPress + medical plugins: appointment booking plugins (Amelia, Bookly), patient management systems, HIPAA-compliant forms. Plugin ecosystem adds medical functionality fast. For practices wanting customization‚ÄîWordPress superior flexibility. Trade-off: maintenance, security updates, HIPAA compliance responsibility.

Real example: Specialist practice used WordPress with medical plugins: custom appointment booking (specialty-specific intake), patient education blog (health articles), telehealth integration. Direct appointment bookings increased 200% (online convenience), blog drove 500+ monthly visitors (patient education), practice grew from 1 to 3 doctors.

üîß WORDPRESS = Medical flexibility

Clean, credible medical design

For medical practices prioritizing straightforward credibility presentation‚ÄîSquarespace delivers professional results fast. Doctor credentials, services, patient portal, insurance‚Äîlaunched in weekend. Less medical-specific functionality, sufficient for many practices.

Real example: Dermatology clinic used Squarespace: doctor credentials prominent (board certifications), services (treatment options), before/after gallery, patient portal link. New patient inquiries increased 60% (professional presentation), justified premium pricing over competitors, practice grew 40% annually.

HEALTHCARE PLATFORMS: ALL-IN-ONE

PatientPop, Luma Health

For practices wanting comprehensive solution‚Äîthese platforms combine website + patient engagement. Trade-off: higher cost ($300-800/month), less design control. Best for practices prioritizing patient acquisition over website customization.

New patient acquisition increased 150% (platform's patient network), online bookings grew to 60% of total (convenience), practice revenue increased $400k annually.

üìä PLATFORMS = Patient growth

For HIPAA priority: MediUpdates (healthcare-specific compliance). For patient acquisition: PatientPop/Luma Health (all-in-one growth). Most successful: Squarespace initially, add WordPress plugins when practice grows beyond template capabilities.

MEDICAL PRACTICE WEBSITE BEST PRACTICES
CREDENTIALS + PORTAL + BOOKING = PATIENTS

Medical practice websites succeed through: doctor credentials prominent (education, board certifications, affiliations), patient portal accessible (test results, appointments, messages), appointment booking easy (online scheduling, phone prominent), services clear (treatments, procedures), insurance accepted (plans listed), testimonials with outcomes (patient results, specific improvements), location/contact visible (map, directions, parking). Most medical website mistakes: buried credentials (why trust you?), no patient portal (patients want access), appointment booking difficult (friction loses patients), insurance not listed (will you accept mine?). Best practice: credentials above fold, portal link prominent, booking one-click, insurance visible.

ATTRACTING PATIENTS

CREDENTIALS PROMINENT = TRUST

Board certifications, education, affiliations

Display credentials prominently: Medical Degree (MD, DO), Board Certifications (American Board of Speciality), Hospital Affiliations, Medical School, Residency. Homepage header with credentials builds instant trust. Buried credentials in About page lose patients‚Äîmedical decisions require confidence in provider qualifications.

Real example: Doctor buried credentials in About page (hard to find). Low inquiry rate. Moved Board Certification, Harvard Medical School, Mayo Clinic affiliation to homepage header. New patient inquiries increased 80% (qualifications visible immediately), justified premium pricing, patient trust scores increased 40%.

PATIENT PORTAL ACCESSIBLE = RETENTION

Test results, appointments, messaging

Patient portal essential: prominent link (homepage header), easy login, mobile-optimized. Patients expect access: test results, appointment scheduling, prescription refills, doctor messaging. No portal or buried portal link frustrates patients‚Äîmodern healthcare is digital-first.

Real example: Practice required phone calls for test results (no portal). Patients frustrated, administrative burden high. Added patient portal link homepage header: test results online, appointment scheduling, secure messaging. Patient satisfaction increased 50%, administrative calls decreased 60%, no-shows decreased 30% (appointment reminders).

APPOINTMENT BOOKING EASY = CONVERSION

Online scheduling, phone prominent

Appointment booking must be frictionless: \"Book Now\" button homepage header, online scheduling (real-time availability), phone number prominent (clickable on mobile). Many patients (especially younger) prefer online booking‚Äîno phone calls required. Complex booking processes lose patients to competitors with easier scheduling.

Real example: Practice required phone calls only for appointments (no online booking). Lost patients to competitors with online scheduling. Added \"Book Online\" button homepage header with real-time availability. Online bookings increased 200% (convenience), new patient inquiries increased 60% (easy access), after-hours bookings captured 30% more patients.

INSURANCE ACCEPTED = QUALIFIED LEADS

Plans listed prominently

Display insurance prominently: major plans accepted (Blue Cross, Aetna, United, Medicare), homepage header or dedicated section. Patients need to know: will you accept my insurance? Hidden insurance information frustrates callers‚Äîpatients call competitors with clear insurance information.

Real example: Practice buried insurance information in FAQ (hard to find). Received 50+ daily calls asking \"do you accept my insurance?\". Moved insurance plans to homepage header (logos + list). Insurance inquiry calls decreased 80% (information visible), qualified new patient inquiries increased 40% (right-fit patients), administrative time saved 10 hours/week.

üéØ MEDICAL PRACTICE VERDICT: Trust + Access = Patients

Medical practice website success depends on: doctor credentials prominent (Board Certifications, Medical School, affiliations - new patient inquiries increase 80%), patient portal accessible (test results, appointments, messaging - patient satisfaction increases 50%), appointment booking easy (online scheduling, phone prominent - online bookings increase 200%), insurance accepted (plans listed - inquiry calls decrease 80%), services clear (treatments, procedures - patient understanding), testimonials with outcomes (patient results, specific improvements - social proof), location/contact visible (map, directions, parking - access). Most mistakes: buried credentials, no portal, difficult booking, hidden insurance. Best practice: credentials above fold, portal prominent, booking one-click, insurance visible.

üéØ MEDICAL PRACTICE VERDICT: Credentials + Access = Patient trust

Best platforms: Squarespace (small practices, professional credibility), WordPress + medical plugins (customization, HIPAA-compliant forms), MediUpdates (HIPAA priority, healthcare compliance), PatientPop/Luma Health (patient acquisition, all-in-one growth).

Platform choice depends on: practice size (solo vs group), specialty (primary care vs specialist), appointment volume, HIPAA requirements. Most successful medical practices: Squarespace initially (professional credibility), add WordPress plugins or healthcare platform when practice grows beyond template capabilities.

Essential elements: doctor credentials prominent (Board Certifications, Medical School, Hospital Affiliations homepage header - new patient inquiries increase 80% when qualifications visible immediately), patient portal accessible (prominent link homepage header, test results online, appointment scheduling, secure messaging - patient satisfaction increases 50%, administrative calls decrease 60%), appointment booking easy (Book Now button homepage header, online scheduling real-time availability, phone prominent - online bookings increase 200% when frictionless), insurance accepted (major plans listed homepage header: Blue Cross, Aetna, United, Medicare - insurance inquiry calls decrease 80%, qualified leads increase 40%), services clear (treatments, procedures, specialty services - patient understanding), testimonials with outcomes (patient results: \"treatment reduced pain 90%\" - social proof builds trust), location/contact visible (map, directions, parking information - access).

Medical practices sell through trust and accessibility‚Äîcredentials (Board Certifications, Medical School, hospital affiliations) displayed prominently build professional authority that justifies patient confidence. Healthcare is high-trust‚Äîpatients need to see qualifications immediately before booking. Patient portal access (test results, appointments, messaging) is expected in modern healthcare‚Äîpractices without portals frustrate patients and lose them to competitors with digital-first approaches. Appointment booking must be frictionless (online scheduling real-time availability, prominent phone)‚Äîcomplex booking processes lose patients to easier alternatives. Insurance visibility (plans listed homepage header) filters unqualified calls and saves administrative time‚Äîpatients call competitors with clear insurance information. HIPAA compliance is non-negotiable for medical websites‚Äîforms, patient portals, and communication must meet healthcare privacy standards. Start with Squarespace for professional presentation (credentials, services, contact), add patient portal and online booking as practice grows (patient expectations increase). Healthcare-specific platforms (PatientPop, Luma Health) worth premium cost for practices prioritizing patient acquisition over website customization.

DECISION FRAMEWORK FOR DOCTORS

‚úÖ CHOOSE Squarespace IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You're a solo practitioner or small practice (1-5 doctors)
  • ‚Ä¢ You want professional, trustworthy design immediately
  • ‚Ä¢ Staff needs to easily update the site (no developer needed)
  • ‚Ä¢ You want to launch fast (1-2 weeks)
  • ‚Ä¢ You'll use HIPAA-compliant form plugins
  • ‚Ä¢ Budget is $46/month + form plugin
  • ‚Ä¢ Mobile optimization matters (71% of traffic)

Best for: 75% of doctors in private practice

‚úÖ CHOOSE WordPress IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ HIPAA compliance must be built-in (native plugins)
  • ‚Ä¢ You need advanced appointment scheduling
  • ‚Ä¢ You have multi-doctor practice (5+ providers)
  • ‚Ä¢ You want complete customization
  • ‚Ä¢ You have budget for developer ($5K-15K)

Best for: Multi-doctor practices needing HIPAA-native functionality

‚úÖ CHOOSE Webflow IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You're a specialist or surgeon (branding critical)
  • ‚Ä¢ You want unique, custom design that stands out
  • ‚Ä¢ You have budget for designer ($8K-20K)
  • ‚Ä¢ You need complex before/after galleries

Best for: Specialists needing custom branding

‚ùå AVOID for Doctors:

  • ‚Ä¢ Template-heavy platforms without customization: Look generic, damage credibility
  • ‚Ä¢ Platforms without HIPAA-compliant options: Risk patient data, potential fines
  • ‚Ä¢ DIY sites that look unprofessional: Patients judge doctor competence by website quality

Doctor websites must look professional. Compromising on design = lost patients.

üí° DOCTOR WEBSITE FORMULA

Squarespace for 75% of doctors. Professional design, easy management, HIPAA-compliant with plugins. WordPress for multi-doctor practices. Webflow for specialists. Always prioritize trust, professionalism, and patient experience. Your website is your digital reputation.

BOTTOM LINE FOR DOCTORS

Squarespace: Best overall for doctors. Professional templates, easy to use, staff can manage. 9/10 for most doctors.

WordPress: Best for multi-doctor practices. HIPAA plugins, appointment scheduling. 8/10 for practices 5+ doctors.

Webflow: Best for specialists needing custom branding. 7/10 for surgeons, dermatologists.

Wix: Adequate but requires skilled customization. Can look generic. 7/10 with expert design.

63% of patients choose their doctor based on website information.
Doctor websites must build trust + demonstrate expertise. Squarespace = Professional + Easy.
